result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher J Lucas

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 

Deft appears via video, in custody, pro se.  
Date and time set for review re: public defender representation prior to preliminary hearing. 
Court notes counsel has not yet been appointed. 
COURT finds good cause to extend time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Prelim set for 09/12/2022 to be removed from calendar. 
Review set for 09/14/2022 at 1:00 pm in Courtroom B. 

Adj: 1:05 pm.

Review hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Indigency hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:10 am.

No contact with victim(s): M.A.K. or their residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Rothschild PD). No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:04 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Paige Metzman, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $5,000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): M.A.K. or their residence.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Rothschild PD). 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

RH: 9/7/22 @ 1:00 p.m. Courtroom B.
